title: Ovechkin nets 892nd, now 3 from breaking mark
content: Alex Ovechkin moved three goals away from breaking Wayne Gretzky's NHL record after scoring the 892nd of his career in the the Capitals' loss at Carolina on Wednesday night.

title: Hendrickson: Bengals' comments 'disappointing'
content: Defensive end Trey Hendrickson said Wednesday that he's disappointed and confused by Bengals executive Katie Blackburn's recent comments on his contract talks with the team.

title: Sources: NBA probes Morant's finger-gun gesture
content: The NBA is looking into Grizzlies star Ja Morant using his hands and arms to mimic shooting a gun toward the Warriors' bench during Tuesday's game, sources told ESPN.

title: Willard downplays flak: 'Time everyone moved on'
content: New Villanova coach Kevin Willard said he was aware of the criticism he received since leaving Maryland but said, "I just think it's time that everyone moved on."

title: Sources: Sacramento St. to apply for FBS status
content: Sacramento State plans to file an application with the NCAA this week to transition from the FCS to the FBS in football as an independent, sources told ESPN.

title: 76ers' Embiid set for arthroscopic knee surgery
content: The Philadelphia 76ers announced that star center Joel Embiid is set to undergo arthroscopic surgery next week on his troublesome left knee.

title: Agent: D-backs, Marte reach $116.5M extension
content: Diamondbacks All-Star second baseman Ketel Marte has agreed to a six-year, $116.5 million contract extension which begins this season, his agent told ESPN.

title: Sources: 10 groups enter bids for pro flag football
content: Ten groups have submitted bids to the NFL to be investors in new women's and men's professional flag football leagues, sources told ESPN.

content: Liverpool had to sweat it out to win the latest Merseyside derby, but it was enough to see Arne Slot's team move closer to the Premier League title.

content: USWNT coach Emma Hayes has made it clear she's shaking up the U.S. roster for the 2027 Women's World Cup. Let's look at how that's going.

content: Saka made his return after being out for three months, making an instant impact for Mikel Arteta's Gunners.

content: USWNT captain Lindsey Heaps hailed teammate Trinity Rodman in her return to international duty after an eight-month injury absence.

title: Simeone defends Atlético's season after Copa exit
content: Atlético Madrid coach Diego Simeone maintained that his team has "competed well" throughout the season despite recent eliminations from the Copa del Rey and the Champions League.

title: USMNT's Adams: Pro-rel would improve MLS
content: USMNT midfielder Tyler Adams has voiced his support for bringing promotion and relegation to MLS, saying it would improve the competitiveness of the league.

title: Pep hails Grealish after dedicating goal to brother
content: Pep Guardiola labelled Jack Grealish "an incredible human being" after the midfielder dedicated his goal against Leicester City to his brother on the 25th anniversary of his passing.

title: Gotham bans fan for abuse of Orlando's Banda
content: NJ/NY Gotham FC has banned a supporter from future matches and revoked their season ticket for using hateful language toward Orlando Pride's Barbra Banda last week.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal begin talks with Nico Williams
content: Arsenal are reportedly plotting a move for Spain starlet Nico Williams this summer. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: PM Modi leaves for visits to Thailand, Sri Lanka

title: All parties should abide by Constitution, Trinamool is fighting for Waqf properties, says Mamata
content: The remarks by Trinamool Congress came on the day when Union Minority Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju tabled The Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2025

title: India’s vital efforts to tackle air pollution could worsen warming
content: Aerosols in the atmosphere scatter sunlight and have a cooling effect — yet they also exact a heavy toll on human well-being

title: India should use the ‘window of opportunity’ to finalise a ‘stronger’  FTA with Sri Lanka, says economist
content: The proposed FTA could ‘cover services; allow freer movement of some classes of workers and overcome protectionist blockages in both countries — which are, I think, more on the Sri Lankan side,’ the economist said, adding that closer relationship between the two neighbours ‘should not upset other powers — China and the U.S. — which have stakes in Sri Lanka.’

title: No violence reported in Manipur in past four months, Ministry to convene a meeting of both communities soon, says Amit Shah in Lok Sabha
content: Amit Shah said that the President’s rule was imposed when majority of the MLA’s said they were not in a position to form the government after the resignation of Chief Minister N Biren Singh on February 9.

title: Donald Trump announces 26% ‘discounted reciprocal tariff’ on India
content: As he announced the tariffs, the U.S. President held up a chart that indicated that India charged 56% tariffs “including currency manipulation and trade barriers,” and America would now charge India a “discounted reciprocal tariff” of 26%

title: KITEX Telangana units will employ around 50,000 people, says Sabu Jacob
content: Kerala is not serious about helping industrialists, and there have been repeated attempts to virtually terrorise the company management through raids and inspections, the managing director alleges

title: Seek Centre’s special package for farm loan waivers, Maha Congress tells Mahayuti
content: Congress leader Harshavardhan Sapkal also questioned Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis’s promise of resolving Khadakpurna Canal water issue

title: IIT-Madras sets up centre to study science of happiness

title: J&K parties express dismay over Waqf Bill; State Waqf Board chairperson Andrabi welcomes move

title: Bombay HC pulls up Centre, State for delaying Abu Salem’s premature release petition
content: Salem had challenged an order passed by the special Terrorist and Disruptive Activities Act (TADA) court on December 10, 2024 that rejected his petition for premature release

title: Gujarat firecracker blast: Kin of Banaskantha victims say bodies taken away without consent
content: Family members from Madhya Pradesh stage protest outside Banaskantha hospital; Congress MLA Mewani alleges conspiracy; factory owner and son arrested, SIT formed

title: Navy signs agreement with Kirloskar for design, development of 6MW marine engines
content: Prototype diesel engine with indigenous content of over 50% will be developed at a cost of ₹270 crore with 70% funding from the Government of India, says Defence Ministry

title: 2002 Gujarat riots: HC upholds acquittal of six men in killing of three Britons
content: The High Court considered testimonies of witnesses and investigating officer, and observed that it did not find any reason to interfere with the judgment and order of acquittal passed by Principal District and Sessions Judge at Sabarkantha

title: U.S. national arrested for entering restricted island in Andamans
content: Polyakov remained offshore for an hour, blowing a whistle to attract attention, but received no response. He landed for about five minutes, left some items on the shore, collected sand samples, and recorded a video before returning to his boat, police said

title: Bombay High Court directs registry to place Disha Salian’s case before appropriate Bench
content: Satish Salian had filed a petition last month seeking a fresh investigation into the death of his daughter, Disha Salian, alleging that she was brutally raped and murdered

title: Disquiet in J&K govt. as L-G establishes complete control over bureaucracy
content: In March this year, the J&K government drafted the Business Rules and forwarded it to the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) for approval through the L-G office

title: Maharashtra Pollution Control Board does not accept that water bodies are dying, says fishing community
content: As fishing community continue to raise their concerns over contamination of water bodies due to heavy industrial pollution, Maharashtra Pollution Control Board’s report says pollution is found within the permissible limits.

title: Different shades of support from NDA allies for Waqf Bill
content: BJP allies speak in many voices, with JD(U) and Shiv Sena offering wholehearted support, LJP being circumspect, and TDP urging the govt to give the States more powers to determine the composition of Waqf Board

title: Ahead of BIMSTEC summit, doubts persist over Modi-Yunus meeting
content: This is the first physical BIMSTEC since the pandemic; PM Modi to meet Thai King, Thai PM and hold bilaterals with several countries; last week’s Myanmar quake has drawn attention to the summit

title: UGC analysing feedback on draft faculty appointment guidelines: Pradhan
content: Suggestions have been made on improvements to the provisions on the role of Chancellors, and the constitution of the selection committee for appointing Vice Chancellors

title: Bombay High Court imposes ₹25,000 fine on Anil Ambani for seeking swift hearing in tax notice
content: Industrialist Ambani sought an urgent hearing on March 27, in a petition challenging an Income Tax department notice dated April 12, 2022; court terms it an “artificial urgency”

title: Review meets held regularly to track work on Chennai Port-Maduravoyal elevated corridor project: Minister
content: Responding to a question from Tiruchengode MLA E.R. Eswaran, Minister E.V. Velu says that as per the contract agreement, the work is scheduled to be completed by February 2027. The NHAI has indicated that the project is likely to face more delays, he adds

title: Kolkata principals hit out at Calcutta University for unilateral decision on PG exams’ venue
content: A prominent body of principals spoke out against the university registrar for reportedly saying that there was no need to consult them while taking a decision to conduct exams for PG students in colleges other than their own

title: Lok Sabha passes Waqf Bill after 12-hour debate
content: 288 members vote in favour, 232 against; Home Minister accuses Opposition of ‘fear-mongering’ for vote bank politics, assures Muslims the new Bill doesn’t interfere with their religious practices

title: Committees constituted to amend nuclear liability laws
content: The government committees discuss amendments to Atomic Energy Act and Civil Liability for Nuclear Damage Act to allow private companies in nuclear sector

title: Transport sector, industry slam Karnataka diesel price hike
content: The Karnataka Lorry Owners Association, supported by independent truck drivers and petrol pump owners, has called for an indefinite strike from 10 a.m. on Saturday urging the government to hold a state-level meeting to address their concerns.

title: State govt. to offer 47 diagnostic tests at doorstep of residents via MMU
content: The new service provider has agreed to do the 20 common tests at a cost of ₹195 per person, with a reasonable charge for disease specific tests. Each MMU vehicle will screen 35 persons daily.

title: HC appoints Senior Advocate to inquire into dispute over conduct of Madras University journalism dept. examination
content: While a student had claimed to have written the exam on May 11, 2024; the university asserted that no such examination was conducted on that day

title: Relatives grief-stricken after eight die in explosion at West Bengal’s Pathar Pratima
content: Police say firecrackers were stored in the house; one family member who allegedly operated a nearby firecracker unit held

title: Nagas in Manipur, Nagaland rally against Myanmar border fencing
content: Nagas who live on either side of the border criticise the Centre for continuing the British practice of separating the communities

title: Odisha fails to collect compensation from miners accused of illegalities, says CAG
content: Odisha government fails to collect ₹4,000 crore from illegal miners, despite Supreme Court orders, reveals CAG report

title: Ready to felicitate PM Modi in public meeting if he endorses BC quota Bill, says Revanth
content: The Chief Minister demanded that Mr. Modi step down from his post if he does not endorse the hike in quota

title: Assam to have two-phase panchayat polls in May
content: The two-phase election in May is expected to be a test of popularity for the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party and its allies

content: AIISH observes World Autism Day with teacher training workshop; the event aims to equip teachers with the necessary skills to support children with ASD

title: Govt. owned aircraft repair company staffers on protest
content: As AIESL’s privatisation drags on, the strength of contractual staff increases to 65%, who have been demanding ‘equal work, equal pay’ as per government rules on Fixed Term Employment

title: HC orders Telangana government to stall ground levelling works, cutting trees on land abutting UoH allotted to TGIIC
content: ‘No destruction, no cutting trees’, said the Acting CJ towards the end of post-lunch session, adjourning the matter to Thursday for continued hearing

title: Waqf amendment Bill an attack on Constitution, says Opposition
content: Congress MP Gogoi says the government has four goals — ‘to dilute the Constitution, defame minorities, divide the Indian society and disenfranchise the minority communities’

title: Yellow alert for 8 districts on Thursday; IMD forecasts excess rains in April
content: Pathanamthitta, Ernakulam, Idukki, Thrissur, Palakkad, Malappuram, Kozhikode, and Wayanad are put on yellow alert

content: The project is among the 12 proposed by the State government for which approval was sought during Siddaramaiah’s meeting with Gadkari

title: Biker killed in collision with MLA Raju Kage’s nephew’s car in Belagavi
content: Eyewitnesses tell police that the MLA’s nephew, Sripad Siddanagouda Kage, was driving the car; investigation is on

title: BJP begins day-and-night dharna against price rise
content: The Opposition party is set to launch a State-wide tour titled ‘Janakrosha yatre’ against price rise from April 7

title: Ajit Pawar asks NCP workers to steer clear of criminals, focus on development
content: NCP chief made his comments during a visit to Beed, which comes in the wake of Dhananjay Munde’s resignation as a Cabinet Minister and NCP leader last month

title: Maoists offer conditional talks; Chhattisgarh says ready for dialogue but with no conditions
content: Letter comes ahead of HM’s Chhattisgarh visit; says government must halt anti-Maoist operations, stop setting up armed forces camps; State says Maoists free to approach through any channel, without conditions

title: Nirani terms talks of him switching parties or Shivakumar joining BJP as baseless rumours
content: Expelled MLA Yatnal is an experienced politician and he may not form a new party, says the BJP leader

title: India braces for Trump tariffs on U.S. ‘liberation day’
content: As markets worry about impact, U.S. President calls it ‘liberation day for America’; India has highest average MFN applied tariff rate; in trade talks, India has agreed to slash import duties on majority of U.S. goods

title: Singapore promises steps to renew partnership on Amaravati capital construction project in Andhra Pradesh
content: Chief Secretary Vijayanand promises full cooperation to the Singapore Government delegation in taking the project forward, and says that Prime Minister Narendra Modi is likely to relaunch the capital works this month

title: CBG plants to produce one crore tonne of organic manure for farmers: RIL
content: The plant at Divakarapuram village will transform 15 lakh acres of barren land into fertile farmland, boosting farmer incomes, says RIL executive director

title: Man sentenced to life imprisonment for killing woman a decade ago
content: Based on the submissions of witnesses, the court convicted Siddaiah and sentenced him to life imprisonment along with a ₹10,000 penalty

title: NBA Power Rankings: What to watch for all 30 teams as season's end nears
content: teams are snapping up postseason spots but the race to avoid the play-in tournament is changing by the day . at the bottom end of the standings, several teams are straddling the fine line between a strong finish and improving their lottery chances for the no. 1 draft pick .

title: Donald Trump Announces 26% "Discounted Reciprocal Tariff" On India
content: President Donald Trump on Wednesday announced huge new tariffs of 34 percent on imports from China and 20 percent on imports from the European Union -- two of the main US trade partners.

title: Live: Reciprocal Tariffs Set To Take Effect This Weekend, Says White House
content: US Tariff Announcement Live Updates: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday announced a raft of tariffs, targeting countries around the world. He declared a 26 per cent "discounted reciprocal tariff" on India.

title: Waqf Bill Clears Lok Sabha With 288 Votes In Favour, 232 Against
content: The Waqf Amendment Bill sailed through the Lok Sabha early on Thursday after a marathon 12-hour debate that saw the government and the Opposition go toe-to-toe on the contentious bill well-past midnight.

title: Parliament Updates: Lok Sabha Passes Waqf (Amendment) Bill After Intense Debate
content: Parliament Updates: The Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2025 was cleared with a majority in the Lok Sabha late late on Wednesday, after an over 12-hour debate.

title: Inside Trump's Reciprocal Tariffs: Which Countries Are Hit Hardest
content: After weeks of anticipation, US President Donald Trump unveiled sweeping new tariffs on trading partners Wednesday, calling it a "declaration of economic independence."

title: No Russia On Trump's Tariff's List Days After "Pissed Off" At Putin Remark
content: After weeks of anticipation, US President Donald Trump on Wednesday unveiled his reciprocal tariffs plan by declaring a 10 per cent baseline tax on practically all goods imported to the United States.

title: Trump Tariffs Q&A: How Soon Will Prices Rise, Are Other Countries Taxing US
content: President Donald Trump followed through on his tariff threats by declaring a 10% baseline tax on imports from all countries and higher tariff rates on dozens of nations that run trade surpluses with the United States.

title: 'PM Is My Friend But...': What Trump Said While Announcing India Tariff
content: While announcing his country's "reciprocal tariffs" on those who tariff the United States, Donald Trump recalled his brief remark to Prime Minister Narendra Modi regarding trade ties with India, when the two leaders met in Washington recently.

title: Donald Trump Announces Reciprocal Tariffs On Countries. See Full List
content: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday acted on his campaign promises to "build that wall" and announced a raft of tariffs targeting countries around the world, including some of America's closest trading partners, in a move that risks sparking a rui

title: "Ready To Fight": How World Leaders Reacted To Trump's Reciprocal Tariffs
content: Escalating a global trade war, US President Donald Trump unleashed a barrage of reciprocal tariffs to match duties put on US goods by other countries.

title: 26% US Tariffs On India To Hit Domestic Players: Top Exporters Body
content: India's apex exporters' body, FIEO, stated on Thursday that the 26 per cent tariffs or import duties announced by US President Donald Trump on India will undoubtedly affect domestic players.

title: US Man Arrested For Entering North Sentinel Island In Andamans: Cops
content: A US national was arrested in Andaman and Nicobar Islands for allegedly entering the prohibited tribal reserve area of the North Sentinel Island, police said on Wednesday.

title: "Like Mahatma Gandhi, I Tear This Bill": A Owaisi During Waqf Bill Debate
content: Asaduddin Owaisi, chief of AIMIM and the MP from Hyderabad, today held a symbolic protest against the Waqf Bill, citing the example of Mahatma Gandhi.

title: Stocks Slump, Gold Hits New High As Markets React To Trump's Tariffs
content: Stocks slumped, bonds surged, and gold hit a new high as markets braced for the impact of US President Donald Trump's sweeping reciprocal tariffs on Thursday.

title: Air Force Pilot Dies After Jaguar Fighter Jet Crashes In Gujarat
content: A Jaguar fighter jet of the Indian Air Force crashed in Gujarat's Jamnagar. While one pilot was ejected before the crash, the other died.

title: Trump’s 26% 'discounted' tariff: Is Indian economy relatively insulated?
content: US President Donald Trump announced new reciprocal tariffs to counter high duties charged on US goods by foreign countries. With tariffs on countries like China, India, and the EU, the move aims to rebalance trade.

title: 'PM Modi great friend': Trump announces 26% 'discounted' tariff on India
content: US President Donald Trump announced a 26 per cent 'discounted' reciprocal tariff on India, stating that past charges were not entirely reciprocal. At a 'Make America Wealthy Again' event in the Rose Garden, Trump referred to Prime Minister Narendra Modi as a 'great friend' but criticized India for its unfair treatment of the US.

title: 'Going to fight': How world leaders reacted to Trump's tariff move
content: President Donald Trump announced a 10% baseline tariff on all US imports, excluding Canada and Mexico, intensifying a trade war. World leaders, including those from Canada, Australia, Spain, Ireland, and Italy, expressed concerns and vowed countermeasures to protect their economies and workers while condemning the potential negative impacts of these tariffs.

title: How BSNL's 'Reliance Jio mistake' may have cost the govt Rs 1,757 crore
content: The government incurred a loss of Rs 1,757.56 crore as BSNL failed to bill Reliance Jio for passive infrastructure sharing for a decade, as revealed by a CAG report. Additionally, BSNL's negligence in its agreement with RJIL resulted in further revenue losses due to non-adherence to the escalation clause.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for April 3
content: Top stock market recommendations: Aakash K Hindocha recommends Computer Age Management Services, PCBL Chemical, and Balrampur Chini Mills for today. Following significant market movement, Nifty is poised for potential retracement while Bank Nifty shows resilience.

title: IAF fighter jet crashes in Gujarat's Jamnagar, one pilot dead
content: A Jaguar fighter jet crashed near Jamnagar during a training mission, killing one pilot and injuring another. The incident caused a massive fire and panic among nearby villagers. Emergency teams responded quickly, and the injured pilot was taken to GG Hospital. The exact cause of the crash remains unknown.

title: ‘Sikandar’ day 4 box office: Salman-Rashmika film stays under Rs 10 crore
content: Salman Khan and Rashmika Mandanna's 'Sikandar' was released on March 30, 2025, and has accumulated ₹84.45 crore in four days. Despite its high initial expectations, the film received mixed reviews and witnessed a substantial post-Eid drop in earnings, recording a 50% decline on day 4.

title: Google AI chatbot Gemini head steps down; read Google DeepMind CEO memo to employees
content: Google has replaced the head of its consumer AI division, with Sissie Hsiao stepping down and Josh Woodward taking over. This change aims to accelerate the development of the Gemini application. Despite a rocky start, Google's AI tools have shown significant improvements, outperforming competitors in recent benchmarks.

title: Canada and Mexico missing from Trump's reciprocal tariff list. Here's why
content: President Donald Trump announced new tariffs, imposing a 10% baseline tax on most imports, with increased rates for nations with trade surpluses. Notable exceptions include Canada and Mexico due to existing agreements. High tariffs target China, the EU, South Korea, Japan, and Taiwan, with a new 25% tariff on all foreign-made automobiles, sparking concerns of global retaliation.

title: Was engaged to provide CEEW services for USAID task: ASAR
content: ASAR Social Impact Advisors clarified that it received Rs 8 crore from USAID for services provided under a Clean Air Better Health project with CEEW. The company denied receiving any foreign direct investment and affirmed full compliance with legal requirements amid an ongoing investigation by authorities.

title: Disaster on every metric ...: Musk's DOGE is hurting Tesla; this may be a proof
content: Tesla reported a 13% drop in Q1 deliveries, falling short of Wall Street expectations. CEO Elon Musk faces criticism over his association with President Trump and DOGE, while production disruptions and vandalism attacks compounded issues. Rivals like Rivian also struggled. Musk aims to stabilize Tesla with new products and autonomous driving software.

title: 'Friend is worst than foe': Full list of Trump’s reciprocal tariffs
content: US President Donald Trump announced significant tariffs on imports, including a 34% tax on Chinese goods and 20% on the European Union. The move, aimed at reducing trade deficits and bolstering American manufacturing, has sparked concerns about potential global trade wars and rising consumer prices. Several US allies are considering retaliatory measures, which could impact diplomatic relations.

title: Not powerless against mockery of anti-defection law, SC tells Telangana
content: Supreme Court reprimanded the Telangana CM and assembly speaker over alleged MLA defections. The court asserted its power to enforce the anti-defection law, especially when the speaker delays disqualification decisions. The bench highlighted its role as a constitutional protector and warned against making a mockery of the 10th Schedule.

title: Rally in Manipur against Myanmar border fence
content: Thousands protested in Ukhrul, Manipur against the Union government's decision to end the free movement regime (FMR) and build a barbed-wire fence along the India-Myanmar border. Tribal communities, like the Tangkhul Naga, voiced strong opposition, stressing that the move would sever familial ties and heighten tensions.

title: H. Shankar assumes charge as CPCL Managing Director
content: health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: How US Teacher Accused Of Raping Student Reacted To Charges Against Her
content: Christina Formella, a teacher at Downers Grove South High School, looked shocked when police stopped her car on March 16 and asked her to "grab whatever she needed."

title: Average adoption waiting period climbs to 3.5 years
content: The adoption process in India remains lengthy, with an average wait time of three and a half years for infants. Despite the number of adoptions reaching over 4,500 in 2024-25, thousands of prospective parents continue to wait anxiously, with the demand for younger children far exceeding available orphans for adoption.

title: In Nepal's classrooms, youngsters wonder if republic has delivered
content: The 2001 Nepalese royal massacre resulted in the monarchy's end and a republic with frequent leadership changes. Rising disillusionment among the youth has led to a resurgence of pro-monarchy sentiments, driven by political instability and a lack of direction. Many students are calling for reliable governance.

title: Trump tariff: Officials set for all-nighter to assess impact
content: Several officers in the commerce department in India are gearing up to assess the impact of US President Donald Trump's reciprocal tariffs on Indian exporters and businesses. A war room has been set up for this purpose, amid concerns about potential dents on margins and bargaining power shifts.

title: SC: State can't decide on rural stints for doctors from outside
content: The Supreme Court criticized the Uttarakhand government's 2009 policy requiring non-state students in MBBS courses to serve in remote areas or pay Rs 30 lakh. The court emphasized that this policy should be a uniform decision by the Union government, citing challenges faced by students from other states in serving in inaccessible regions.

title: SC panel records top cop's statement on fire at judge's house
content: The Supreme Court commission investigating the March 14 fire at former Delhi High Court judge Yashwant Varma's residence has recorded statements from Delhi Police commissioner Sanjay Arora and other senior officers. Arora detailed that the storeroom with cash was kept locked and located near a CRPF guard room.

title: NMC reviews disability norms to focus on what candidates can do
content: The National Medical Commission is revising disability guidelines for medical course admissions to focus on candidates' performance abilities rather than disability percentages. This follows a Supreme Court directive and aims to outline essential medical competencies crucial for safe practice, provoking criticism over the composition of the reviewing committee.

title: Owaisi cites Gandhi, rips Waqf Bill copy; Jagdambika Pal counters
content: Lok Sabha saw a heated exchange as Asaduddin Owaisi tore the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, calling it unconstitutional and an attack on Muslims. Owaisi's actions were criticized by BJP's Jagdambika Pal. Union Minister Amit Shah asserted that the bill aims to regulate Waqf properties and prevent their exploitation. The bill faces intense debate in Parliament.

title: Break-up should not result in rape case: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court addressed the increasing trend of rape cases filed on the grounds of false promises of marriage. While hearing a man's plea to quash rape charges by his fiancée, the bench remarked that relationship break-ups should not result in rape allegations. They decided to examine the arranged marriage situation in detail.

title: Only 1 in 100 women aged 45+ get screened for breast cancer: Study
content: Routine health check-ups can save lives, as evidenced by 46-year-old Sheetal Thakur, whose early-detected breast cancer was treated successfully. Despite such benefits, only 1.3% of Indian women undergo mammography due to lack of awareness and unfounded radiation fears, hindering early cancer detection.

title: With coconut & coke, American tried to befriend Sentinelese
content: A US national, Mykhailo Viktorvych Polyakov, was arrested for entering prohibited North Sentinel Island in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. He was remanded to custody with video evidence confirming his visit. Polyakov claimed to be a thrill seeker and had previously attempted similar actions, including making contact with isolated tribes.

title: Maoists seeking a ceasefire? Can't accept conditions: Government
content: Maoists, impacted by continuous security operations, propose a ceasefire and peace talks. They allege government offenses including mass killings and sexual violence. The Chhattisgarh home minister insists these claims are false, calling for Maoists to initiate genuine talks without conditions, stressing the state's commitment to law enforcement.

title: IPL 2025: Blazing Buttler flattens RCB
content: Jos Buttler's explosive 73 off 39 balls led Gujarat Titans to an eight-wicket win over Royal Challengers Bengaluru. Supported by Sai Sudharsan’s 49, the Titans swiftly chased down 169 runs, concluding the game with 13 balls to spare. RCB struggled to establish momentum, with GT bowlers maintaining control throughout their innings.

title: Father-son duo held for Gujarat blast that killed 21
content: The Deesa firecracker factory blast, which killed 21 people, was caused by the deliberate negligence of Khubchand Mohanani and his son Deepak, who instructed workers to keep the shutters closed to avoid detection. The explosion was triggered by the presence of aluminum powder used in the production of firecrackers.

title: Over 300 projects receive forest clearance in J&K for various projects
content: Over 300 development projects in Jammu & Kashmir received forest clearance, promoting infrastructure and economic growth. This includes road networks, water supply schemes, and 4G saturation. Necessary compensatory afforestation will be undertaken to maintain ecological balance.

title: Pakistan opens unprovoked fire, breaks truce along LoC in Poonch sector
content: Pakistani soldiers violated the ceasefire along the Line of Control in Poonch, J&K. Indian troops responded effectively, maintaining control over the situation. This incident follows earlier breaches and highlights ongoing security concerns with 70 to 80 Pakistani terrorists currently active in the region.

title: Siddaramaiah faces fresh Muda trouble as ED challenges Lokayukta report
content: Karnataka chief minister Siddaramaiah faces new legal challenges as the Enforcement Directorate (ED) contests a Lokayukta police report clearing him in the Muda site allotment case. ED claims significant evidence against Siddaramaiah and seeks the Special Court's intervention. Opposition allege bias in the Lokayukta's findings.

title: 2-year-old eats raw meat, dies of bird flu in Andhra Pradesh
content: A two-year-old girl from Andhra Pradesh's Palnadu district has died of avian influenza (H5N1) after consuming raw chicken. This is the state's first documented human fatality from bird flu. Health officials have declared a high alert, urging caution and thorough cooking of poultry to prevent further incidents.

title: Haridwar to be butcher-free, meat shops to exit city limits
content: Authorities in Haridwar are relocating all butcher shops outside municipal limits to improve sanitation and control stray dogs. Around 100 shops, mostly in Jwalapur and Jagjeetpur, will be affected. Validly licensed shops will move to a new site in Sarai village while illegal ones will be sealed. Residents have long complained about the poor hygiene of these shops.

title: Shun tilaks at party events, says DMK MP A Raja, starts a row
content: DMK MP A Raja has urged party members to avoid Hindu religious symbols when wearing party attire, stating that it blurs the line between the DMK and RSS. This statement has provoked backlash from BJP leaders, who accuse him of undermining Hindu traditions. DMK asserts it's Raja’s personal view.

title: 'Fence sitters could ... ': Why Waqf politics may help NDA in Bihar
content: Nitish Kumar's support for the Waqf Amendment Bill in Lok Sabha marks a strategic shift in his political stance, potentially realigning votes in Bihar's upcoming assembly elections. Analysts suggest this move may help the NDA consolidate support, despite possible backlash from Muslim voters.

title: Injury scare! Virat Kohli hurts finger during RCB vs GT clash
content: During the RCB vs GT IPL 2025 match, Virat Kohli injured his finger while fielding. Despite the injury, Kohli continued playing but seemed uncomfortable. Mohammed Siraj led GT's attack, reducing RCB to 42/4 before a recovery led by Livingstone, Sharma, and David. Kohli’s injury could impact RCB’s struggling season. Fans await updates.

title: Indian-origin drug kingpin jailed for 18 years in UK
content: Heemal Vaid, an Indian-origin drug trafficker, has been sentenced to 18 years in prison for orchestrating the import and distribution of over 4 million pounds worth of cocaine and heroin. The NCA identified him through encrypted messages on EncroChat and revealed his extensive drug importation and money laundering activities.

title: Watch: Gukesh, Anand dance to Bollywood beats in Vidit's wedding
content: World Chess Champion D Gukesh and Viswanathan Anand were seen dancing to popular Bollywood songs at fellow Grandmaster Vidit Gujrathi’s wedding, showcasing a rarely seen fun side of the GMs. Gukesh will participate in the Paris Freestyle Chess Grand Slam, while being closely followed by Arjun Erigaisi in the FIDE chess rankings.

title: Trump told inner circle Elon Musk will soon step back: Report
content: Donald Trump hinted that Elon Musk would soon go back to his business wrapping up DOGE, something that Musk already said. "He's got a big company to run ... At some point he's going to be going back," Trump reportedly said about Elon Musk. "He wants to. I'd keep him as long as I could keep him." Trump said agencies that worked with DOGE learned a lot and they should be able to handle the work.

title: 'You're entitled to your disappointment': Goenka to LSG players
content: Lucknow Super Giants owner Sanjiv Goenka encouraged his team to regroup after their eight-wicket loss to Punjab Kings in the 2025 IPL. Despite a strong partnership from Nicholas Pooran and Ayush Badoni, LSG only posted 171/7. Punjab Kings chased comfortably, led by Prabhsimran Singh's 69 and Shreyas Iyer's 50*. Punjab is now second, while LSG is sixth.

title: Watch: Bat in air; video goes viral during IPL clash
content: During the IPL 2025 match between RCB and GT, Liam Livingstone's bat unexpectedly flew out of his hands, amusing fans. RCB struggled initially, with top-order collapses. However, Livingstone's 54-run knock helped RCB reach 169/8. The flying bat moment became a viral sensation, adding a humorous twist to the tense game.

title: 'His remark on Northeast misinterpreted': Aide of Yunus
content: A senior aide of Bangladesh's interim government head Muhammad Yunus clarified that Muhammad Yunus' remark about India's seven northeastern states was made with honest intentions and misinterpreted. The statement stirred strong reactions in India. Bangladesh seeks a possible meeting between Yunus and PM Modi at the upcoming BIMSTEC Summit.

title: In 10 big numbers - Waqf and its properties in India
content: A heated debate occurred in the Lok Sabha over the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, with Congress criticising it as unconstitutional and BJP defending it as necessary to prevent misuse. The Bill focuses on stricter criteria for Waqf declarations and amendments meant to enhance regulation and prevent illegal occupancy and misuse of Waqf lands, which are significant in India.

title: The Warriors fan whose courtside looks turned into an NBA fashion brand
content: a woman was wearing a painted and bejeweled Warriors jacket in 2021 . her sister, Jodie, launched DannijoPro, a label of NBA apparel . payton's sister has made custom pieces for the warriors .

title: Yashasvi Jaiswal Quits Mumbai, Submits Application To Change Team: Report
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal has reportedly decided to quit the team and join Goa from the next season onwards . he is said to have written an email to the Mumbai Cricket Association seeking a No Objection Certificate to change his cricket state team .
